author: mr.goose
title: subHandles | ADA Handle
description: Organizations presently need to purchase multiple unrelated root ADA Handles in order to organize different payment addresses and have zero guarantee that all the related Handles will be available.

f6_assessments.q0: Ada Handle has provided a clear and concise description of the issue in their problem statement - a solution to organize different payment addresses and guarantee consistency across handles. It extends the set of features of Ada Handles, which is on the path to becoming the most adopted project within Cardano and the naming standard across the network. The proposal will therefore have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem as a whole by allowing a wider range and more imaginative uses for their existing solution. The proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the handles, has a scaling plan, and propose innovative solutions to the problem (NFT-based and Virtual sub handles). This update will bring great value to the project, and allow it to compete on the crypto scene with the more known competitors by delivering a unique set of features. This proposal addresses the challenge effectively, thus I'll rate this proposal a 5/5.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has given a good and clear account of what experience/skill sets will be necessary to deliver on the proposal, as well as a complete description of who the team members are (PapaGoose, Conrad, Goose and BigIrishLion), including their roles and some past work. If anyone doesn't trust this team, there is not much hope for other Catalyst projects.

The budget is outlined very clearly and is broken down into identifiable items (hardware, dev time, project management and other ressources) and the amount requested seems reasonable to achieve the set goals.

The roadmap is very detailled and clear, broken down in 4 stages that make sense - from private testnet to public launch. They provided the details of the tasks, the order of execution, the timetable for completing the project is realistic and the resources necessary are listed.

The Ada Handle team has indicated some the risks they identified with the solution they want to build and has given some indication of how they will mitigate them (a portal to revoke sub handles for instance).

Given the experience and plan presented by Ada Handle team, it is very likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides a clear and detailled roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. The metrics that define success are presented and make sense - an app that works without issue, the standard is widely adopted by the community and actively used for authentication, organization and transparency. The team has explained how they will track the progress of the development of their project - using an internal ERP software, daily meetups, monthly and weekly reports and an external third-party audit.

The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal, and this is why I give auditability a 5/5 rating.

f6_assessments.q0: ADA Handle are proposing to introduce a subHandle change to the ADA handle standard that will mean that existing handle holders can take their handle as a root address and then create child handles for that root handle which are called subHandles. A number of examples are provided for how sub handles could be used such as from families, SPOs and organisations. The solution described outlines the usage of both virtual handles that are owned and maintained by the root handle as well as NFT based sub handles that can be issued by owners of the root handle. The main risks for sub handles that are covered is the issuing of an NFT sub handle and how this could result in issues where the root or sub handle holders change, the solution for this is to maintain a list of which sub handles are verified so that the NFT sub handles issued don't hold power in perpetuity. The demand for this proposal is well articulated and backed from existing users of the ADA handle standard which highlights that the execution of this proposal could create high impact within the community soon after its implementation. Due to this it looks very likely that this proposal could produce a high impact for the community in an solution that a growing amount of the community are using.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal breaks down the roadmap for this proposal into four phases. Two involve iteration and testing on a private or public testnet, one on marketing efforts and the final one for a main net launch. Each phase has an itemised list of associated tasks for that phase to be completed and what is involved which is thorough and inclusive of each of the development steps required. A budget break down is provided with the manual labour multiplied by the hourly rates, the infrastructure costs and the audit cost. In terms of the team details provided the core team members or ADA handle are listed with their background and history. There are a number of highly technical individuals in the team and the same team helped to deliver the original ADA handle standard which provides further evidence that the team has the competencies to execute this proposal. It would have been good to have a professional profile link for those involved just to give even more evidence of background for the voters and assessors. Overall the plan is detailed, budget break down is reasonable and articulated and the team has the right experience and evidence of being able to execute that I have a high confidence this proposal is feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal team have provided their Github profile in which you can see which repositories they have open sourced. In terms of tracking progress the team have listed their internal approach to how they handle monitoring progress but also have mentioned weekly and monthly reports and the external third party audit which is something the community will be able to audit themselves. Success for the proposal has details for the effective implementation of the subHandle standard. The clarity of the proposal is very high and very easy to follow and understand the exact intentions of the proposal and the reasons it is being proposed. In terms of improvement it would have been good to know more exacts on what will be open source from what is being developed and how that may benefit the community. This is both good on an auditing perspective but also as a community educational resource that speeds up other development efforts in the ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0:
As far as I know, the ADAHandle project is understood as a standardized NFT that developers and users can use to associate an address with a custom and human-readable address. The issue raised by the author here is that organizations need to purchase multiple native ADA processors unrelated to different billing addresses, and there is no guarantee that all the related Handles will be available. That is, they want to release multiple subHandles associated with their root Handles to specify a variety of tasks, but without the need to use dashes, underscores, or full stops. As a workaround for this problem, the proponent came up with a solution that is "SubHandles". This solution identifies most of the problems of the challenge. Because it improves and integrates new features for the ADAHandles platform on Cardano. This will attract more organizations and users; provide value to the ADA community and the broader ecosystem.
The proponent described his solution in great detail and reasoned well. By providing specific examples and detailed analysis of 2 subHandles formats, which are NFT-based subHandles and Virtual subHandles. Besides, the proponent also mentioned the main risks that may be encountered when implementing this project. These risks are all related to NFT-based subHandles and Virtual subHandles. Each format poses different risks, but the team has identified solutions to reduce those risks.
f6_assessments.q1:
This is a detailed and clear plan, with pictures to make it easier to visualize. The roadmap is divided into 4 phases and has a specific timeline. Each stage is clearly stated with certain tasks and goals.
The proposed budget represents 3.14% of the total Challenge budget. This amount has been allocated into fractions corresponding to the expenses. At the same time, the author has also given the basis for this calculation (hours and average amount per hour). I find this budget analysis to be reasonable. But to be better, in my opinion, the author should present those expenses in more detail.
The project team all works at ADAHandles. They are people with many years of experience and competence in many different fields. The proposer provided detailed and complete information about the members. Their identity is also easily verified through the project's website. In addition to this proposal, some members of the group have many other proposals also submitted in Fund 9. They have had proposals funded from previous Funds. I found that they fit perfectly with the goal of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
Auditing is a very important part of every project. With this proposal, the team prepared tools, tactics and strategies to track key metrics. However, I am of the opinion that the 3rd party audit really makes sense given the decentralization of the project? Is this auditor reputable? I think that the project can incorporate thanks to the community itself for auditing, it will be transparent and increase its decentralization. The latest information, work progress, weekly & monthly reports of the project will be continuously updated on the project's communication channels such as Twitter, Github, Disco, and Youtube... for the community to easily monitor and evaluate. If possible, the team should organize live streams to share about the project to increase interaction with the community. At the same time, the community will have feedback and make contributions to make the project better.
The success of the project is very clearly defined. That's: all DApps, wallets and communities adopting the new Sub-Standard; Cast and release SubHandles, using them for validation, organization, and transparency; Mint portals and smart contracts work exactly as designed without any hitches; The new checkout cart works perfectly, allowing multiple Handles and subHandles to be purchased.

f6_assessments.q0:
Considering that many projects do need a sub-handle to the root $handle that they own for the project, this proposal clearly and effectively addresses the issue. 

I am particularly happy to see that they have proposed to use both  the NFT Metadata Standard (CIP-25), an NFT on the chain, as well as virtual NFT's using the IPFS-hosted JSON-formatted datasets.

This dual way of minting enables two options for projects, ISPOS, SPO's, and the like to come up with a solution that best fits their needs.

This is a very well laid out proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has laid out 4 phases in which the proposal would go through. They then broke each phase down into sub categories, or phases that would take place in each major phase (Phase 1-4).

The proposer also laid out the exact dollar amount that each part of the budget will need allowing us to see where the funds would end up. 

When you combine all of this with a team made up of:
- PapaGoose – Master Platform Engineer (25+ years experience)

- Conrad Cordeiro – InfoSec and Infrastructure Engineer (15+ years experience)

-  BigIrishLion – Master Platform Engineer(12+ years experience)

And then also add on that this same team made the original root $handle, it becomes clear that this project will be implemented very successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer has stated the following:

- Our internal ERP software (ERPNext) with its Project Management framework that will allow us to monitor phase workflows.

- Daily standup meetings with the entire team to track individual progress and assist with specific tasks.

- Weekly & monthly reports to demonstrate what the team accomplished and determine the next tasks.

- External third-party audit that will check our work throughout the entire process.

With all of these in place, it should be relatively easy to audit the progress of the project. 

However, I would have liked to have seen the proposer tell us if the daily standup meetings would be recorded in some form. To simply list it may mean an individual would need to listen in all the call or stand or sit in the meeting, or may mean that it will be recorded and easily played back for auditability purposes.

With that said, this proposal is very well laid out, the proposer have already successfully developed and deployed ADA Handle, have laid out that they will deploy a third party audit throughout the entire process, have laid out what completion will look like and have made auditability very simple for this proposal.

solution: The owner of a root Handle, such as $acme, will have the option to issue as many subHandles as needed and allocate them to any Cardano-based payment address. Examples: treasury@acme and john@acme.
